marginalia.translation: The perpetual growth of singular parts.

position.marginalia_text: Quotidiè [--] Qua[nt]um profecere s[--]or horarum [-] alio: quid animo, corpori, fortuna contuleris: quantum hodiè increueris Natura, arte, actione: qua[e] & Cuiusq[ue] interna[e], externa[e]q[ue] partis auxesis: qua[e] tuaru[m], aut humanaru[m] rerum Multiplicatio? Ta[e]deat plus scribere: pudeat nondu[m] scire necessaria: iuuet omnes supplere defectus: cordi Sit statim lectitare efficacissima, illicò operari vtilissima; confestim omnes Mundi professores, actoresq[ue] superare. Expedit Eudromo: refert Chrysotechni: decet Eutrapelum: oportet Vnicum: conducit Principi: interest Subditi: Hoc agere: vrgere Hoc: nunq[uam] cessare, aut morari: Semper pergere proficiendo; proficere pergendo: quotidiè magis, magisq[ue] crescere: nec vllum finem facere augendi Singula bonorum genera: quatenùs ulla potest humana industria. Vnico Artis, Virtutisq[ue] filio, nihil scientiaru[m] aut experimentoru[m] difficile. Salue profice: uale.

marginalia.translation: Daily [...]. To accomplish so much [...]: what you may gather in mind, body, and fortune: today you may grow so much by nature, art and action: [....] the growth of every internal and external part: which are the multiplication or your or human matter? May he tire in writing more: may he be ashamed in not yet knowing necessary things: may it please him to compensate for all failures. May it be agreeable to repeatedly read the most effective things at once, and to immediately use the most useful things; to immediately surpass all the professors and actors of the world. It is profitable for Eudromus; it repays Chrysotechnus; it is proper for Eutrapelus; it is necessary that he be a unique man; that he be profitable to the Prince; that he differ from the subordinate; To do this, to urge this: never to cease or to delay: always to proceed in order to accomplish, always to accomplish to proceed; to grow more and more daily, and not to make an end to the growth of the singular kinds of good things: as far as there can be any human industriousness. To the sole son of art and virtue, nothing of the sciences or experiments is difficult. Welcome, accomplish: farewell.
